NYU Grossman School of Medicine is one of the nation's top-ranked medical schools. For 175 years, NYU Grossman School of Medicine has trained thousands of physicians and scientists who have helped to shape the course of medical history and enrich the lives of countless people. An integral part of NYU Langone Health, the Grossman School of Medicine at its core is committed to improving the human condition through medical education, scientific research, and direct patient care. For more information, go to med.nyu.edu, and interact with us on LinkedIn, Glassdoor, Indeed, Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.
Position Summary:
We have an exciting opportunity to join our team as a Data Analyst.

In this role, the successful candidate We are seeking a qualified Data Analyst to provide support for data management and analyses for projects in the Division of Healthcare Delivery Science. The Data Analyst will mainly work with clinical, administrative and operational data, and be responsible for planning, designing, and implementing statistical analyses. A successful applicant will be able to work autonomously and comfortably in an academic medical center environment.
The Data Analyst will report to Dr. Saul Blecker in the Division of Healthcare Delivery Science and work closely with faculty in the Division of Biostatistics, both in the Department of Population Health. Projects will include a new federally funded initiative to develop and evaluate a system-level intervention to address medication adherence. The analyst will also collaborate in support of hospital clinical faculty in development and analyses of new research projects.
Job Responsibilities:
Maintain and clean data from electronic health record (EHR) databases and other sources in support of research protocols and projects.
Interface with varied research collaborators, both within the School of Medicine and the Medical Center.
Play an active role in providing clinical data for operational improvements.
Perform reviews to ensure accuracy and completeness of data.
Provide technical assistance to analysts and researchers in accessing and analyzing datasets, as needed.
Support the development of publications and conference presentations, including drafting academic and nonacademic publications and creating tables and other data visualizations for presentations.
Under supervision of research faculty and with the guidance of the teams lead biostatistician, conduct statistical analyses and present them to the team and collaborators.
Minimum Qualifications:
To qualify you must have a Masters degree in pertinent field (statistics; biostatistics; epidemiology; data science; healthcare economics) OR Bachelors degree with relevant work experience.
At least 2 years of work experience and/or research experience in a relevant setting.
Strong quantitative skills and advanced programming skills in R and/or SAS.
Ability to select and apply appropriate statistical methods for collecting, summarizing, and analyzing EHR and other data.
Excellent organization, time management, and communication skills.
Knowledge of principles and methods of biostatistics; principles, theories, and procedures of epidemiology, including study design, statistical analysis, and causal inference.
Ability to work both independently and as part of a collaborative research team.
Experience with database queries and SQL is a plus.
Qualified candidates must be able to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization.

NYU Grossman School of Medicine provides its staff with far more than just a place to work. Rather, we are an institution you can be proud of, an institution where you'll feel good about devoting your time and your talents.

Salt Lake Community College has made a commitment to becoming a data-informed institution to meet ambitious strategic planning metrics. The analyst 2, data engineer will work in Data Science and Analytics alongside a team of rockstar analysts, data visualizers, data scientists, and leaders to continue the development of the college’s data warehouse.

The mid-level data engineer will develop, construct, test, and maintain analytical data architectures containing institutional data for Salt Lake Community College. This data engineer will be a key player in data warehouse architecture and development including identifying business needs, investigating and relating disparate data sources, and creating efficient and performant data pipelines that process raw data into valuable data structures. This position will support our currently on-premises data architecture and be involved in our plans for moving to the cloud. The data engineer will proactively identify data quality issues and create quality assurance checks, reports, or apply transformations as needed. This position will also develop and support our machine learning operations (ML Ops) in developing processes for regular, timely runs of machine learning models. The data engineer may also develop reporting or models to communicate complex data relationships or transformations.

Data Warehouse/Storage: Oracle 19c, GCP, AWS
ETL: Wherescape, SQL, Python, Airflow (planned)
Reporting: Cognos, Tableau, Oracle APEX
Project Management: Jira

This work will include ingesting GB/TB level data and running QC and prep procedures to analyze the data. You will provide support, troubleshooting, and guidance for both internal and external clients, helping navigate the data requirements needed to assist some of the largest Fortune 500 companies with their retail forecasts.
Responsibilities:
Acquire and compile structured and unstructured data and verify its quality, accuracy and reasonableness.
Perform analyses of historical data to surface trends and insights using statistical methods.
Full life cycle activities of data analytics to include requirements and design, data cleaning, developing analysis capabilities, and linking databases and data sets.
Continuously monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements in modeling process; and to do related work as required.
May own and manage recurring analytic or reporting processes.
Perform basic data management, data cleansing and statistical analysis using SQL, Python, R, or other programming languages.
Effectively communicate technical and general information requirements to a variety of audiences.
Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.
Requirements:
Proficiency in navigating computer systems. The ability to learn new data systems quickly, and comply with evolving data integrity and security standards.
Highly motivated and organized with the ability to work well in teams, and independently, on multiple simultaneous projects.
Strong written and oral communication skills, with ability to be efficient and consistently deliver high-quality work under time constraints.
Minimum of one (1) year of full-time, professional work experience with data cleansing, data management, and statistical analysis.
Knowledge in the use of data analytics, management, and visualization software (e.g., SQL, Python, R, Glue, Tableau, Quicksight, ArcGIS). Familiarity with AWS is a plus
Ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Please submit all resumes to jobs@planalytics.com.
Job Type: Full-time

ABOUT COLOR OF CHANGE
Color Of Change is the nation’s largest online racial justice organization. As a national online force driven by millions of members, we help people respond effectively to injustice in the world around us, moving decision-makers in corporations and government to create a more human and less hostile world for Black people in America. We activate our members to take action on crucial issues — from criminal justice to media representations to the social safety net and voter freedom — so that we can build the power necessary to transform the written and unwritten rules of society.
ROLE SUMMARY
This position reports to the Senior Data Manager. We are undertaking a major expansion of our data, analytics, and engineering capabilities to turbocharge our campaigns for change. Our electoral campaigns, grassroots lobbying, and representation work generates a flood of data, some of which we are currently using to inform our work. But we’re just scratching the surface - so much more is possible. That’s why we are making investments in our data operation to ensure more and more of our data can be analyzed, and then leveraged, to guide our strategic and tactical decisions.
Strong candidates will excel in effective communication of technical concepts to a broad audience, and display comfort with creation of data analyses that lead to concrete recommendations for our program. By conducting exploratory analyses, communicating best practices for tool usage, and presenting findings and recommendations in digestible formats, this role powers the organization's innovation in digital campaigning and organizing.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Reporting and Analysis (50%)
With support from your manager, use internal and external data sources to find trends, spot patterns, and highlight opportunities for our campaign work
Translate data into easy-to-read spreadsheets, dashboards, and visualizations to provide ongoing analysis and insights for our program
Build lists for engaging and organizing members and high-potential voters typically excluded in campaign mobilization models
With the team, develop internal standards for managing and moving data across multiple systems, ensuring data integrity, quality assurance, and a high level of documentation and transparency
Analyze, summarize, and present data in a manner accessible to non-technical decision makers
Collaborate with other team members to write queries, gather data, and do other data/analytics tasks as needed.
Campaign Tools Support (50%)
Respond to a range of data support requests from our campaign teams; provide friendly, helpful, and timely support on technical issues for staff at all levels of technical knowledge
Identify ways to train and empower regional field managers and organizers to best use data tools (VAN, Thrutext, ActionKit, etc) to inform decision-making
Monitor tools/systems to make sure standards are being followed, dive in to clean or upload data when needed
Facilitate increased tagging adherence with users for better data analysis
EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS
This is an early career to entry-level position, and a qualified candidate should have:

A strong racial justice analysis with the ability to effectively integrate this analysis in your data work, including identifying moments where racial justice may affect the collection, analysis, and presentation of our data.
Strong communication and people skills: This person will work in close partnership with our campaign teams, so you’ll need to support staff with data requests and communicate technical info in a kind, approachable, and empathetic way
Familiarity with SQL and the ability to learn more skills quickly. At the start of this role you should be familiar with SQL and able to write queries with simple joins. While on the job, you’ll work with other team members to become comfortable doing complex joins and analyses in SQL
Strong skills in Google Sheets or Excel; you should be comfortable using formulas such as INDEX/MATCH and manipulating spreadsheets to analyze and present data
Commitment to the mission of Color of Change: to help people respond effectively to injustice in the world around us, moving decision-makers in corporations and government to create a more human and less hostile world for Black people in America
Additional experience, but not required
Knowledge and understanding of political and advocacy campaigns, especially experience as a field or digital campaigner in the progressive space
Familiarity with common progressive tech tools like ActionKit, NGP/VAN, calling & texting tools, either as a user or administrator
Experience using CRM, email, marketing, or business intelligence (Action Kit, Sisense, Mailchimp, Tableau, Looker, etc.) especially as an analyst
Familiarity with types of programming languages or analysis tools other than SQL
HOW TO APPLY
Click the "Apply for this position" link and submit a resume and COC-specific cover letter. Applications will be received on a rolling basis.

MORE INFORMATION
Union Position: Yes

Location: Remote [US based]

COMPENSATION
The salary for the Associate Data Analyst position is $63,000. This is a full-time exempt position. Color Of Change also offers a competitive benefits package.

Color Of Change (COC) is an equal opportunity employer. COC prohibits unlawful discrimination against any employee or applicant for employment based on race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, age, national origin, genetic characteristics, disability, status as a special disabled veteran or veteran, marital status, sexual orientation, sexual identity or any other basis prohibited by law.

JOB TITLE: Analyst Sale Analytics & Data Management

REPORTING TO: Sr Manager, Sales Analytics & Data Management

Our Team
Worldwide Television Distribution is based in Culver City and responsible for licensing features, series and formats to linear and digital platforms worldwide. The team has a very open and collaborative culture with a focus on individual development and innovation. Senior leadership of the team is highly accessible and fosters growth. The working environment is enriched by the mix of talent from sales, engineering, business development and management consulting. The LA based Sales Analytics and Insights team collaborates with teams globally and focuses on both local and international projects.
The Role
The Analyst must have advanced knowledge of Excel and have the aptitude to quickly learn SQL and other BI tools (e.g. Tableau and Altyerx). The candidate must have a curious mindset, with an impeccable attention to detail and passion for problem-solving. This role is a great opportunity to learn about the television distribution sales business and the analytics and data science beyond the deal making.
The Analyst’s primary responsibility will be to ensure the robustness of the monthly data ingested by the internal IT teams and develop methods to provide confidence in the data quality. In addition, he/she will assist with analytics and insights including deal analysis bringing together deal/licensing nuances, performance data and market dynamics. Analysis will involve excel modelling and data visualizations tools.
This role operates at the intersection of advanced analytics, business intelligence and data systems and as such, the candidate must have a passion for analytics and data. Experience diving into analytical problems and synthesizing disparate data sources is required. Experience in analytics, coding, and/or a basic understanding of machine learning algorithms, data science concepts and SQL are a plus.
The Responsibilities
Data Management (50%)

Analytics & Insights (50%)
Assist with complex analysis involving multiple data sets, algorithms/heuristics that capture the complexities and nuances in licensing deals and normalizing performance data.
Create excel models for performance analysis and use data science techniques where applicable to enhance analysis.
Business sense check the outputs of analysis and incorporate market dynamics leveraging the nuances of TV Distribution business.
Create and maintain insightful Tableau dashboards. Provide advanced visualization and dashboard customizations to business users.
Conduct monthly analysis such as competitive analysis to provide inputs to senior leadership for strategy formulation.
Contribute to the bespoke analysis and insights for deals.
Present the insights and visualizations to sales teams and help drive business decisions.
Qualifications:
Education and Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Engineering, Business Management, Finance, Economics or relevant field is strongly preferred.
A minimum of 1-2 years relevant experience is required. Experience in TV distribution, sales planning or related areas is a plus.
Technical and Analytical Skills
Highly proficient in Excel (i.e. pivot tables, formulas) and other Microsoft Office applications.
Aptitude to learn new technologies and systems used to pull and analyze data including Tableau, Alteryx and account specific vendor data portals.
Strong data manipulation, data cleaning and data visualization skills for summarizing large data sets in order to facilitate decision making and strategic planning
Programming experience in any language (R, Python, SQL etc) is a plus
Communication and Time Management
Curious, quick learner and detail oriented
Self-motivated, flexible and able to operate under changing priorities and/or tight timelines
Ability to prioritize multiple important projects
Excellent communication and presentation skills. Ability to tell a clear, concise, and actionable story with data
Proficient at establishing relationships with cross-functional peers
Proactive, positive team-player

Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps. With 6 billions downloads and over 300 million monthly active users, Voodoo is the #1 mobile publisher worldwide.

The company is one of the most impressive examples of hypergrowth in the ecosystem, backed by Goldman Sachs, Tencent, and GBL. Deciding to expand its portfolio of products further, Voodoo has more recently announced its investment in blockchain technology to bring blockchain games to mobile users. Voodoo is now a team of over 600 employees worldwide, we’re looking for talented individuals from across the globe to come and entertain the world with us.

What is your team about?
The Casual Data Team is a centralized structure made up of industry veterans whose mission is to set up an efficient and rigorous analytical framework and toolset to support multiple studios and ambitious projects to drive the growth of Casual Games at Voodoo.
The data team plays a critical role in shaping the success of our games by identifying successful and underperforming patterns and communicating both results and recommendations to our stakeholders. We always seek to improve every piece of our complex analytical stack, from data collection to analytical methods and business impact.
We give all team members ownership of their projects while ensuring they have the right tools and support to grow both personally and professionally.
This role can be handled by candidates based in Spain, Germany, France or England.

What will be your main challenges?
We are looking for a Data/Business Analyst who is deeply passionate about data-driven decisions, transforming raw data into clear actionable business insights, and who is constantly driving themselves and the team towards completing the next challenge.

Analyzing large, complex data sets representing the behavior of millions of online and mobile game players to address strategic and operational business questions.
Provide actionable recommendations and conclusions from game data to shape features, game economies and future product roadmaps.
Work closely with internal departments to drive insights that will help produce better games and insights that will drive towards monetization and retention improvements.
Build automated dashboards and reports to facilitate company-wide awareness and understanding of key business metrics and player’s experience.
Manage multiple projects at a time in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment.

By joining this team, you will have a strong impact on the business and a unique opportunity to reach hundreds of millions of users with your insights and recommendations.

What do we expect?
Previous analytical work experience, preferably for a Web or Mobile company, Online Gaming industry
At least a BA/B.Sc in Statistics / Math / Engineering/ Economy or other quantitative fields
Strong SQL with experience in querying large, complex data sets. Knowledge of R or Python is a plus.
High level of analytical and problem-solving skills with strong attention to details
Ability to turn complex concepts into actionable recommendations
True passion for understanding consumers’ social gaming behavior and tolerance for ambiguity
Experience working with Tableau and DBT is a plus
Advanced knowledge in statistical tools and models is a plus.

THE ORGANIZATION
The Charter School Growth Fund (CSGF) is a leading nonprofit venture philanthropy fund dedicated to identifying the nation's best public charter schools, investing in their expansion, and helping to increase their impact. Our "portfolio" includes 140+ charter school networks that operate 1,100+ schools and serve more than 500,000 students. We are committed to expanding the impact of schools that are closing achievement and opportunity gaps. CSGF operates with the same strategies, discipline, and focus as a venture capital firm by awarding multi-year grants and loans to talented education entrepreneurs building networks of high-quality charter schools that enroll traditionally underserved students. Ultimately, we think the portfolio can grow to serve ~1,000,000 students within a decade.
This is an exciting time to join the Charter School Growth Fund. We are launching our next philanthropic fund in 2022, building on our 15-year track record of success. CSGF's new five-year "Fund IV" will be larger in size and scope than previous funds, with a goal to continue to fuel charter sector growth, accelerate innovation, and strengthen long-term outcomes for students, particularly students of color and those from low-income backgrounds. Our new fund will continue to prioritize investments in leaders of color as our current portfolio is led by more than 50% leaders of color and more than 50% female leaders. We believe it is vital for the networks we support to be proximate to the lived experiences of the students and communities they serve.
THE OPPORTUNITY
About Our Team
With the launch of the next philanthropic fund, the Analytics team is expanding and evolving to meet the growing needs of an ever increasingly data driven organization. The Analytics team sits at the intersection of our investment, impact, innovation, policy, finance, and talent teams which all have data needs to drive their goals. The Analytics team also serves the need to progress monitor CSGF's key performance indicators that measure our impact across the network. These insights are shared internally as well as with our many funders. In addition, we seek to expand the role of analytics to provide direct analysis support to our growing portfolio of charter school networks. To accomplish this, we leverage nationally collected data sets from a variety of sources and provide flexible and timely analysis to our many stakeholders and partners.
The team is made up of three core functions: engineering, data products, and insights research. The full-time permanent role will develop data products, particularly dashboards, for technical and non-technical audiences. This role reports to the Director of Data Products.
Our Analytics Stack
Google Cloud (backbone architecture)
Airflow (data ingestion and orchestration)
BigQuery (data warehouse)
dbt Cloud (data modeling/monitoring)
Tableau (data visualization)
About This Role
As a Data Analyst you will deliver on customer-centered data and analytical products that enhance efficiency, support data-driven decision-making, and enable our organization to scale. Specifically, you will support the growth and maintenance of our current dashboard portfolio in Tableau. In addition, you will have direct involvement in the reporting and analysis of key performance indicators, including student outcomes and school performance metrics.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Below is a general outline of responsibilities. CSGF is a fast-moving organization, roles and responsibilities may change to meet the needs of the organization and the charter networks we support.
It is not expected that every candidate will meet all of the desired qualifications; above all else, we are seeking candidates with an eagerness and ability to learn new skills and solve interesting problems in an environment that encourages creative thinking, quick feedback loops, and opportunities for professional development.
Data Visualization
Build and maintain interactive Tableau dashboards and infographics that enable actionable insights, tailoring visualizations to meet the needs of users while adhering to brand standards
Execute a variety of techniques in Tableau, including forming relationships between multiple data sources, creating field calculations and dashboard actions, and designing more advanced charts (e.g., hex-tile maps, lollipop charts, donut charts, etc.
Synthesize qualitative data, communicating key themes and messages through visualizations
Develop dashboard mock-ups to help elicit and define requirements of data requests
Actively searches for opportunities to experiment with different design approaches and formats, contributing to the team's ongoing efforts to innovate and improve its product line
Data Collection & Validation
Participate in smaller-scale collection cycles throughout the year, including designing surveys, compiling survey results, and reporting outcomes
Perform quality audits of collected data and providing assistance to resolve issues
Support the development and execution of data workflows that ingest, validate, test and model data for analytics needs
Data Modeling and Reporting
Partner with the Analytics Engineer to develop a metrics layer in SQL to centralize organizational key performance measures
Support the Analytics Engineer in transforming datasets for end products, modeling data in a way that empowers end users to answer their own questions
Query from the data warehouse in SQL, calculating and aggregating data when necessary, to respond to data requests.
Support due diligence on high-performing charter school operators by conducting analysis and developing products to display achievement and enrollment data
You're a good fit if you are:
A design-savvy analyst or data-savvy designer with high interest in designing data visualizations and telling impactful stories
Excited about leveraging the wealth of education data we currently collect to influence decision making and increase our impact
Interest or passion in education and commitment to CSGF's mission
You care about questions like:
What is the most essential information to present and visualize in a dashboard?
How can I strategically implement visual design elements (e.g., color, contrast, alignment, white space etc.)?
What would it take for us to always collect valid and clean data for analysis?
How can I ensure that my SQL query returns the correct output to answer the question that Team ABC asked?
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Expected Skills and Characteristics
Exceptional quantitative skills with demonstrated ability to create data visualizations
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of spreadsheets (e.g., Excel, Google Sheets), including lookup functions and pivot tables.
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills and storytelling ability
Strong attention to detail and focus on accuracy over urgency
Capacity to quickly learn new skills, seek honest feedback from peers and mentors, and know when to ask for help
Nice to Haves But Not Necessary
Experience with data visualization tools (ex: Tableau, PowerBI, Looker, etc)
Experience with visual design tools (ex: Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, etc.)
Experience with SQL, specifically in BigQuery
Professional Experience
At least one year of full-time professional experience in data analytics, education, and/or similar fields
WORKING AT CSGF
We are focused on hiring and developing great people and believe that building diverse perspectives across our team makes us more effective in expanding our impact. (This is reflected in Our Commitment to Diversity Statement.) Our core values are:
We work relentlessly to create efficient, measurable, and sustainable results. We strive for excellence and pursue our mission tenaciously. Ideally, you thrive working in a self-directed manner in a fluid environment where flexibility and tenacity are required.
We embrace calculated risks and new approaches. We have an entrepreneurial spirit that welcomes innovation, diversity of ideas, and risk. We rely on you to question conventional wisdom and think independently.
We are truthful, fair, and trustworthy in all aspects of our work. We hold ourselves and our partners to the highest ethical standards. We trust you will too.
We appreciate the challenges faced by education entrepreneurs and recognize the limits of our own knowledge. We understand that our ultimate success depends on that of our partners. Your humility will be key to building trusted and authentic relationships.
We value each of our team members as individuals but believe that we achieve the best results by working together. We willingly sacrifice individual interests and recognition for greater collective impact. We hope having fun at work is important to you and that you are a team player.
COMPENSATION
Compensation is commensurate with experience and education. The target salary range for this role is $65,000 - $85,000 annually. CSGF offers a very competitive compensation package.
START DATE
CSGF is seeking candidates who can start as soon as possible.
COVID-19 VACCINATION POLICY
Unless prohibited by state or local law, CSGF requires that all staff be fully vaccinated with an FDA or WHO authorized vaccine (or approved for an exemption as a reasonable accommodation due to a medical reason or sincerely held religious belief). CSGF abides by each state's requirements and acknowledges those may change over time. If moved forward to the phone screen stage, you have the chance to ask the talent team any questions you may have about this requirement.
Charter School Growth Fund provides equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees.

We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! Who We Need & What You'll Do

The global product team at AccuWeather is seeking a Junior Data Analyst to support the way in which AccuWeather collects, reports, and provides insights to the rest of the organization for our non-mobile and mobile applications. This position is joining an expanding Analytics & Audience team and will collaborate with digital product managers, business stakeholders, and development teams across the organization to help provide ongoing analytical support. This position will report to the Associate Manager of Digital Analytics.
As a Junior Data Analyst, you will help validate the digital data collection accuracies, document data capture methodologies and measurement strategies with support from the analytics team, leveraging a number of online tools, help interpret complex data and convey concise analysis and recommendations, you will also assist with monitoring KPI's and trends to help drive tactical and strategic business decisions.
To succeed in this role, you should have strong analytical skills, exceptional problem-solving capabilities, and be extremely detail-oriented. This role is perfectly suited for someone with a passion for data, digital technologies, and those interested in leveraging data and technology to improve the end-user experience.

Remote candidates are being considered for this opportunity.
Who We Are
AccuWeather, recognized and documented as the most accurate source of weather forecasts and warnings in the world, has saved tens of thousands of lives, prevented hundreds of thousands of injuries and tens of billions of dollars in property damage. With global headquarters in State College, Pennsylvania; a severe weather center in Wichita, Kansas; and offices in New York City and elsewhere around the world, AccuWeather serves more than 1.5 billion people daily to help them plan their activities and get more out of their day through innovative digital media properties, such as AccuWeather.com and mobile, as well as AccuWeather For Business (AFB), radio, television, newspapers, digital out of home, the 24/7 AccuWeather Network channel and AccuWeather NOW streaming service. Additionally, AccuWeather produces and distributes news, weather content, and video for more than 180,000 third-party websites.
Job Responsibilities
Collaborate with internal teams to define and implement necessary requirements in order to properly report on relevant Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)
Analyze broad data sets and provide strategic and actionable business insights to better inform business decisions
Conduct timely, valuable solutions for ad-hoc data analysis and reporting
Develop and maintain automated analytics dashboards, KPI reports, and data visualizations for cross-functional teams
Conduct quality assurance checks and data validation; identify and resolve issues that arise including reporting discrepancies and data inaccuracies
Maintain detailed documentation of analytics tools, business processes, and measurement strategies
Other duties as assigned
Job Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g. Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Analytics, etc.) or equivalent experience/training
1-2 years of experience in data analysis, or a related field
Prior experience in using Google Analytics, Firebase, or other industry-leading analytics tools (event-based collection services) and familiarity with web data
Technical experience including SQL, some form of coding (Python or R), and ETL processing or data integration tools
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Data Studio
Proficient in Excel, Google spreadsheets, and PowerPoint
Strong analytics skills to obtain and manipulate data, interpret results and turn insights into actionable and measurable strategies
Clear and concise communication skills; able to tell a compelling story using data and quantitative metrics
A genuine interest and knowledge of the media and digital industry landscape, keeping up with emerging technologies and trends
Meticulously detailed with strong organizational and time management skills
Comfortable working both independently as well as collaboratively in a team environment
Willingness to learn and adapt to rapidly changing environment
Demonstrated ability to be a creative thinker and exceptional communicator
Be curious and globally oriented
While we are considering remote candidates, in the United States, AccuWeather is only able to hire team members in the following states due to taxation purposes: CA, CO, CT, DE, DC, FL, GA, IL, IN, KS, KY, MD, MN, MO, NE, NV, NJ, NY, NC, OH, OK, PA, SC, SD, TN, TX, VA, WA, WI and WY.

More About AccuWeather

AccuWeather's innovation-first promise has led to the development of many award-winning and propriety features that are available free to the public, including AccuWeather MinuteCast® Minute by Minute™ forecasts with Superior Accuracy ™, the exclusive AccuWeather RealFeel® Temperature, and AccuWeather RealImpact™ Scale for Hurricanes, among many other revolutionary products for the greater safety, convenience and comfort of our users. Further, AccuWeather serves more than half of the Fortune 500 and thousands of other businesses in the U.S. and globally.
Dr. Joel N. Myers, Founder and Chief Executive Officer, established AccuWeather in 1962 and is considered the "father of modern commercial meteorology." Dr. Myers, a leading creative thinker and visionary, has been named "the most accurate man in weather" by The New York Times and one of the top entrepreneurs in American history by Entrepreneur's Encyclopedia of Entrepreneurs.

Qloo is the Cultural AI, connecting and predicting consumer taste across domains including media, entertainment, consumer products, fashion, and travel. POSITION
As a Data Quality Analyst at Qloo, you will be tasked with contributing and improving Qloo’s quality assurance strategy and processes. The Data Quality Analyst will work closely with the Product and Development team to assess and monitor data integrity throughout Qloo’s data processing and deployment. In addition, you will coordinate with teams to identify, resolve, and verify technical and quality issues that would adversely affect the client experience.
WHAT YOU’LL DO
Coordinate with Product and Business teams to design and manage data quality initiatives and test cases around stakeholder expectations.
Coordinate with Development teams to design and manage data quality initiatives and test cases around new features and product updates.
Actively monitor and evaluate data sets for consistency, accuracy, and completeness.
Assist with identifying and clearly communicating instances and causes of data irregularities.
Help drive optimization, testing, and tooling to improve quality of our data.
WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW
Microsoft Excel or Excel alternatives (Sheets, Airtable, etc.)
Strong analytical skills/problem solving/conceptual thinking
Passionate about quality and attention to detail
AND IT WOULD BE NICE IF YOU KNEW
Familiar with Python or other scripting languages
SQL or familiar with other RDMS
Experience working with data visualization tools like Tableau
MORE ABOUT US
A small, growing team with high output, all of us are passionate about creating. In normal times we're in a sunny, dog friendly office in SoHo, Manhattan, and fully flexible about remote work. Compensation is competitive and hours are flexible.

DESCRIPTION
Description

Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments and individuals from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries.

As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence, and strong team ethic. Morgan Stanley provides a superior foundation for a professional career; a place to learn, to achieve and to grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture.


Department Profile

Technology & Operations Risks (TOR) mission is to deliver first-line defenses to manage Cyber and Fraud risks to Morgan Stanley?s technology, operations and information through risk identification, control management and assurance. This allows the business to operate and grow in a secure and legally compliant manner.
The teams vision is to deliver programs that protect and enable the business, ensure secure delivery of services to clients, adjust to address the risks presented by an evolving threat landscape and meet regulatory expectations.


Team Profile

Within TOR, the Fraud Analytics Team is the focal point for development of analytics that can accurately detect and predict fraudulent activities (ongoing or planned) and behaviors that indicate significant risk to the Firm and its clients. The team works directly with the Fraud Operations team, as well as other busines and technology stakeholders, to design and implement new capabilities as well as address day to day activities that reflect the always changing fraud landscapes that affect Morgan Stanley's clients and assets.

Morgan Stanley has a requirement for an Analyst/Developer skilled in understanding how the business works, how to understand and organize large data sets that reflect the business of the Firm, and how to design and implement analytics to directly detect fraudulent transactions and behaviors. Morgan Stanley's state-of-the-art analytics team is charged with building expert detection and awareness analytics for fraudulent actors and activities that threaten the Firm's clients, assets, and reputation.

Working as a developer, your passion for technology and thirst for innovation will help shape the future of Morgan Stanley's fraud analytic and detection capabilities. Every day you'll be teaming with customers of varying disciplines on cross-functional projects and ensuring that analytic solutions have maximum impact across the business. You'll collaborate with internal teams and business teams alike, creating strategically sound target state solutions that directly reduce risk to the firm. At the end of the day, your work will have tremendous and positive impact on the overall fraud detection and prevention posture of the firm in tight collaboration with teams across Morgan Stanley's global technology community.

QUALIFICATIONS
Qualifications

Primary Responsibilities

This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities. Applicants should expect to gain experience in many of these topic areas, but should have incoming experience in some of these areas, including:
Design and implementation of analytics using large data sets
Discovery of features and expected behaviors within large data sets
Design and implement rule and logic based alerts and analytic tools
Conducting statistics-based analytic/machine learning development (outlier/anomaly detection, Bayesian modelling, ML) in partnership with AI/ML and Technology Partners
Investigation and analysis of financial payment systems and related data and technologies
Fraud analyses designed to satisfy business and regulatory requirements
Strategic thinking and passion for understanding business strategy and business processes
Working collaboratively in teams and developing meaningful relationships to achieve common goals
Implementation and adherence to DevOps principles and Agile methodology
Documenting analytic logic and processes to produce reproducible research and analyses
Skills required (essential)
Practical and applied experience using statistical or general-purpose programming languages (Python require, PySpark preferred) to implement statistics-based analytics / models
Practical and applied experience in SQL (Hive/Impala strongly preferred)
Fundamental understanding of core data science principles
Experience working with end users to understand needs of the business and craft end-to-end solutions with full customer involvement throughout the development process
Experience using relational databases or distributed file systems (ie; SQL, Hadoop) and related tools (ie; Hive, Impala, Spark/PySpark)
Positive attitude and enthusiasm to continually learn new technologies and expand professional skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Awareness/interest in financial fraud activities and risk mitigation
Ability to work in and with a globally distributed team
Skills desired
Developing code that complies to unit testing and SDLC frameworks
A focus on extensible and flexible code development
Experience with git (GitHub, GitLab, Stash, etc), and code review
Experience with Microsoft Azure and or AWS cloud platforms
Experience working with investigation teams
Experience using data analytics in the context of fraud investigation, Financial Services, payment processing, and/or similar fields

The Data Science and Analytics (DSA) team at Salt Lake Community College promotes data-informed decision-making across the college through the curation and distribution of trusted institutional data. We are seeking a Data Analyst to help with querying, validation, and reporting of data for use in quantitative research, routine state, federal or internal reporting, and ad hoc reporting. Additionally, this position will take charge of some of the routine reporting for the office, and provide preliminary descriptive summaries of the data.

Support peer to peer quality assurance
Develop best practices to ensure trust in SLCC data
Develop reports and dashboards
Strategize to build comprehensive data products such as dashboards, reports, and data applications to support data-informed decision-making at SLCC.
Other duties as assigned

WHY BECOME A DEFINER?
Here at RxDefine we ethically empower people to navigate their health. We believe that every human should have low cost, transparent access to the information, products, and services they need to take full ownership of their health.
We are looking for team members eager to join a team and help architect the future of life science commercialization through our SaaS products. We are a small but mighty team of around 60 (for now!) US and Ukraine-based employees. As we grow, we are looking for Definers who want to join us on our growth journey but ALSO willing to be committed to cultural values of teamwork and honesty!
Our founding team has designed and built companies on the consumer front acquired by Google, as well as enterprise tech companies deployed across The Fortune 500. We are backed by some of the best investors in the world, including RRE Ventures, Bling Capital, Founders Fund, Greycroft, and more.
PERKS OF BEING A DEFINER:
Impacting the future of healthcare - your innovations could very likely become the new norm for millions of people.
Working alongside the founders of the company. If you have any entrepreneurial desire to start your own company in the future, you will see first-hand what it takes.
100% fully remote, internationally DISTRIBUTED team, but with frequent opportunities to collaborate in-person.
Technology, office setup & co-working space reimbursement!
Unlimited PTO!
Family leave, up to 10 weeks of 100% paid salary.
Open communication - we believe in being transparent and radically honest with no retaliation.
Competitive salary and equity
Medical/dental/vision benefits
CULTURAL VALUES:
Radically Honest, Dedicated, Independent, Dependable, Empathize & Do What's Right
THE VALUE YOU WILL BRING!
Must have expert-level experience with SQL. We utilize PostgreSQL heavily.
Experience with data visualization tools. We currently use Metabase.
Experience with everyday data science programming languages/tools, such as R or Python + pandas/NumPy
Good applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.

We are looking for a Data Analyst to develop metrics and generate insights to make actionable recommendations. You will also work in cross-functional teams to develop key metrics and drive analytical decision making. We would love it if you could support efforts to ensure data integrity across all platforms and departments and teach others how to be data-centric. You will perform hypothesis testing and test design as well as process, clean, and verify the integrity of data used for analysis so you can present and communicate results in a straightforward manner.

Job Description:
This position focuses the majority of their time producing analytical solutions (reports, dashboards, tools, etc.) for leadership and stakeholders across the organization that supports business or clinical initiatives. This position provides consultation and support in the development, analysis, interpretation, and management of a variety of routine to moderately complex data sources to support process improvement, operations, strategy, cost reduction and increased patient safety and satisfaction.
This position is responsible for providing analytical support - typically at a system-wide level. May work as part of a system-wide team or interact with stakeholders across the system. Typically this position performs analysis on routine or moderately complex projects under general supervision. This position works with data sources serving the needs of customers in one or more business areas:
SelectHealth: Performs analytical activities to support decision making, planning, research, and administration for SelectHealth insurance products and initiatives. Works with diverse datasets including claims, enrollment, premium, provider, care management, benefit configuration, quality, regulatory, and other related datasets.


Core Essentials:
1. Creates reports that answer multiple related questions as well as reports with linked content, drilldown and nested parameters. The report is formatted in such a way that leads the user through the report in a well-organized, easy to understand fashion.
2. Writes ad hoc SQL, including basic selects, joins, use of Where clause and simple functions (e.g., Trunc, Sum, Min, Max, Avg, Concat, etc.).
3. Understanding of Primary / Foreign Keys, Table / Field Aliases, and Partitions / Indexes.
4. Assists in the identification of data quality (accuracy, completeness, etc.) issues. Assists with the process of database design for assigned projects. As appropriate, trains other individuals and teams in the routine use of data collection, analysis, and reporting and interpretation tools for measuring performance.

Additional Essentials:
1. Collaborates with corporate and region resources to design, create, test, and implement analytic tools (databases, reports, web applications, dashboards, etc.) that support enterprise / region needs and to improve data collection and reporting strategies (minimize duplication, redundancy, etc.).
2. Demonstrates intermediate level SQL and data extraction skills (i.e., Uses pre-defined scripts, changes parameters, GUI query (e.g., MS Access, tools with drag-drop query creation capability, and Excel cubes).
3. Uses standard Intermountain Reporting tools to generate reports for end users that interpret data for others to promote evidence-based decision making.
4. Accesses and runs existing reports and retrieve information. Possesses a fundamental understanding of the domain's data and associated data models and uses it to produce high quality material.
5. Compares data output to ensure data accuracy. Creates basic QA test plans and validates data for accuracy.
6. Responsible to document work / projects per enterprise-wide standards (reports, project tracking, databases, etc.).
7. Understands the appropriate use of indexes, partitions, ability to understand ERDs
8. Uses / analyzes Intermountain data sources (EDW, ORMIS, AS400, Essbase, Risk Management, etc.) to meet local and enterprise needs.
9. Provides consultation, data analysis and project management for clinical and business stakeholders across the organization. Communicates technical / analytical concepts to others.
10. Shares important and relevant information with the team. Proactively offers suggestions, provides resources, volunteers for assignments, and removes barriers to help the team accomplish its goals.
11. Participates in Intermountain's analyst community by attending and taking part in monthly analyst community events such as ASK (Analysts Seeking Knowledge).

Bachelor's degree with two years of analytics experience. Education must be obtained through an accredited institution. Degree will be verified.

Job Description:
Are you passionate about data and technology? Would you like to be at the forefront of innovation, working in a fast-paced environment with the resources of an established global tech consulting company? In the role of Data Analyst Apprentice, you will be providing support to consulting and technical teams across various stages of the Software Development Life Cycle. You will play a critical role by contributing to the knowledge management process while interfacing with internal teams to ensure high-quality deliverables.
The Data Analyst Apprentice opportunity is for early-career starters interested in breaking into the tech industry while gaining real-world experience. We believe in the earn-while-you-learn model, so you will work full-time with our partner company while also participating in New Apprenticeships Data Analyst Apprenticeship program, which is at no cost to you. The apprenticeship offers small cohorts, learning hands-on from industry experts, certifications, portfolio building, career coaching, mentoring, plus the ability to earn additional credits towards a bachelor's degree.
Furthermore, New Apprenticeship's Data Analyst Apprenticeship Program is an official registered apprenticeship recognized by the Department of Labor (DOL). Every graduate of a Registered Apprenticeship program receives a nationally-recognized credential from the DOL.
You can learn more about the role and apprenticeship program here: https://hubs.la/Q013KDLt0
Eligibility Requirements:
Because we understand that you're just beginning your career, we're committed to your learning and growth. We're seeking candidates who have the following requirements.
Prior work experience with data visualization, business analytics, business consulting (IDEAL)
Some coding/programming experience: HTML, Python, R, SAS, Java, C++, SQL, CSS, Scala, Ruby, Perl, etc.
Some combination of advanced Excel and data visualization (Tableau, Google Data Studio, Power BI)
Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Develop, construct, test, and maintain architectures
Align architecture with business requirements
Data acquisition
Develop data set processes
Use programming language and tools
Identify ways to improve data reliability, efficiency, and quality
Exclusions:
Our apprenticeship is designed to provide a pathway to a successful tech career where opportunities traditionally do not exist. Therefore, we must insist that all applicants have not yet completed their Bachelor's degree.
Apprenticeship Benefits:
As a way to accelerate your growth, you'll participate in New Apprenticeship's Data Analyst Apprenticeship Program remotely while working with our partner company, a global tech consulting firm. Prior to the apprenticeship program start date, you'll receive 9-weeks of in-demand skills acceleration, coaching, and interview preparation in the Pre-Employment Bootcamp program, which is also remote and free of cost to you.
Once you land your full-time role, you'll start the apprenticeship program in a cohort of 10+ apprentices and complete the program over 12 months, where you can earn 24 college credit hours to transfer towards a bachelor's degree online. *(select colleges apply)
You'll attend remote evening sessions twice a week where you'll dive deep into all things data, including business analysis using various techniques, e.g., statistical analysis, explanatory and predictive modeling, python, coding, and data mining. You'll complete milestones along the way, like earning data certifications to validate your skills, module portfolio projects, etc.
You will also receive support from top industry coaches and mentors to progress through your personal and professional goals skills roadmap while also demonstrating new knowledge and competencies through hands-on application with your portfolio project.
Application Process:
All applicants will go through the New Apprenticeship's interview process, which includes an application, a short project, and an interview with a member of our team.
Accepted candidates will have an additional interview directly with our partner company's hiring manager.

Apprenticeship tuition fees covered as part of your employment - no cost to you

Job Title: Youth Apprentice, Data Analytics Associate, Amazon Jump Start
Job Description:
Ability to work 16 hours per week

Job summary
Our mission is to be Earth’s most customer-centric company. This is what unites Amazonians across teams and geographies as we are all striving to delight our customers and make their lives easier, one innovative product, service, and idea at a time.

This goal continues today, but Amazon’s customers are worldwide now, and have grown to include millions of Consumers, Sellers, Content Creators, and Developers & Enterprises. Each of these groups has different needs, and we always work to meet those needs, innovating new solutions to make things easier, faster, better, and more cost-effective. Come build the future with us.

Come join us to work hard, have fun, and make history!

Key job responsibilities
Data Analytics Associates will work alongside data analysts to gather data regarding business needs and provide insights based on findings. These responsibilities may include acquiring, consolidating and interpreting data, creating reports, and organizing data for business use.

Data Analytics Associates use statistical programming languages to assist in the development and analysis of datasets to develop, implement, and maintain behavioral models. Data Analysts communicate with clear narratives, compelling data visualization, and technical precision, both in person and in writing, to enable recipients to understand the analyses. Data Analysts support more experienced analysts and managers in data analysis, model development efforts and ad-hoc analysis, as needed. This role is highly technical in nature and requires demonstrated attention to detail, execution, and follow-up.

Programming: Use programming language (such as SQL) to access and query data.
Data Analysis: Acquire, consolidate, and interpret data from various data sources.
Creating reports: Create information products with various development tools to communicate findings.
Data preparation: Clean and prepare data for statistical and machine learning modeling.
Data Modeling: Work with a variety of analytical algorithms to build models that explain data relationships and predict potential scenarios.
About the team
Amazon Jump Start employs emerging talent from high schools in historically excluded communities. Apprentices learn on-the-job and make valued contributions on behalf of customers. The program is a complement to in-classroom school learning, designed to accelerate a student’s future career prospects. Apprentices report directly to full-time Amazonians for a maximum 3-year period, increasing their standard work hours as competency level increases. Upon completion of the 3 years, apprentices can take the skills they have acquired into the broader marketplace, leverage their experience to pursue higher education, or apply for a suitable role within Amazon should an opportunity become available.

Organized: You are responsible, possess discipline, and determination. You are focused and a planner who likes to achieve and improve.
Problem Solver: You get energized by solving the problem. You might really love story problems in school.
Good Communicator: You are comfortable talking with all different kinds of people, interests, and walks of life.
Tech Savvy: You feel completely comfortable navigating technology/your computer.
Great Time Manager: You usually thrive during semester-long projects by managing your time well.
Analytical: You tend to see patterns and make connections where others don't.

Who we are...
AvantStay delivers exceptional, unique stays for group travelers. The company has built a tech-enabled millennial hospitality brand to be the new standard for group experience. We are venture funded and growing rapidly in the explosive $100+ billion dollar STR industry.

What we are looking for…
AvantStay is looking for an Analyst, Revenue Data Analytics to lead our ongoing data collection, visualization, and analysis efforts on our Revenue Management, Finance, and stakeholder teams. These efforts are key to enabling the optimization of revenue and dynamic pricing practices, underwriting and other financial and analytical actions which are central to our continued success as we grow into new markets and increase the number of properties in our portfolio each month.

Ideal candidate is a technical, data-driven Analyst who is an expert at accessing data via our data warehouse and APIs, developing dashboards and analysis and leveraging your data science skills to help provide insights and improve our decision-making strategies. You thrive in a high growth environment and have a high degree of operational rigor. You thrive working cross-functionally and can work with a high degree of autonomy, flexibility and ability to think on your feet.
What you’ll do…
Execute the data and analytics strategy and roadmap in collaboration with Finance, Revenue Management, and other applicable teams.
Produce analysis, insights, and recommendations from data, including leveraging predictive modeling and data science methodologies. Examples include supporting Revenue Management with insights to help optimize price points and Underwriting to more accurately forecast revenue.
Implement machine learning methodologies as applicable.
Produce and automate distribution of robust dashboarding and reporting to effectively drive the business, including supporting teams with booking trends and performance views, and other items as needed. Optimize and improve existing revenue analytics dashboards via Tableau and other tools.
Execute and lead analytical, technical and data projects.
Extract data effectively from databases and APIs using SQL and any other applicable methods.
Ensure data integrity, including working closely with IT, 3rd party providers, and others. Work with IT and other teams on data governance standards as applicable.
Execute and improve the setup and onboarding of applicable tools such as Tableau.
Ensure data & analytical capabilities can scale to meet potential volumes, velocities, and variety of data.
Be an active participant and student of the business. Pursue a deep understanding of business functions and collaborate and build relationships with applicable stakeholders to help advance data, dashboarding, and analytical needs.
Maintain a curiosity, awareness and knowledge of new technologies, possible advantages and applicable relevance to our business; initiate and learn new technologies and methodologies as appropriate.
Work-cross functionally to enhance utilization of internal data.
What you’ll bring…
3+ years of relevant progressive experience in data visualization, analysis, and data science.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Finance, Mathematics, Statistics or a related technical or analytical field or comparable work experience preferred.
Demonstrated expert proficiency in SQL and Tableau are required. Experience in other data visualization tools such as Power BI, Looker, or similar are also helpful.
Data science and predictive modeling experience is highly preferred. Machine learning experience is highly preferred.
Familiarity with statistical modeling practices in R, Python, or similar packages is required.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and demonstrated ability to perform quantitative and qualitative analysis.
Solid working understanding of databases/data warehouses; experience with Segment preferred.
Experience working with revenue analytics is highly preferred.
Demonstrated ability to effectively define and resolve problems that balance multiple needs and interests in a fast-paced, high-growth company.
Strong communication skills with the ability to present ideas, instructions and information effectively, both orally and in writing
You are a self-starter and have a bias for action.
Comfortable with some level of uncertainty and unclarity and able to make recommendations to move forward.
Experience conveying and explaining analysis via presentations and/or dashboards to different levels and audiences to enable improved company decision making.
Experience and knowledge in at least one of the following industries is helpful but not required: real estate, travel, hospitality, hotels, tourism and the short-term and vacation rental market.

Team bonding and off-site events

Job Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

Blizzard Entertainment’s games don’t just begin with an idea and end once the game is released. So much more goes into their creation and we support our games for years after they’re in the hands of gamers world-wide. Blizzard’s Global Insights organization is composed of teams of incredible engineers and talented analysts who work hand-in-hand with designers, commercial strategists, and business operations teams across the company. We pride ourselves on our ability to add value to our games and players with a combination of data analytics expertise, business acumen, and genuinely geeking out on Blizzard products and culture!
Global Insights is looking for a skilled data analyst to work with petabytes of cross-franchise data to communicate KPI’s to senior finance, platform, and commercial leaders across the entire company. Our unique blend of challenges, opportunities, environments, and people all help make Blizzard a studio worthy of your career.
Covid-19 Hiring Update: We’ve transitioned to a work-from-home model and we’re continuing to interview and hire during this time. This role is expected to begin as a remote position. We understand each person’s circumstances may be unique and we will work with you to explore possible interim options.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Partner with analysts and engineers to clearly report business-facing KPIs that measure the health and success of Activision Blizzard games used by millions of players worldwide.
Comprehensively address both high-level and detailed strategic questions by clarifying the business requirements, developing hypotheses, and building an analytical structure to address the inquiry.
Write effective queries against big data sources that return results accurately, maximize database efficiency, and are ready to scale for the future.
Leverage tools such as Tableau, Big Query, Airflow, & Git to deliver insights and provide visibility to key metrics across the business.
Collaborate with Marketing, Finance, Game Business & Commercial Leadership, Product teams, and regional analytics partners to deliver business impact, effectively communicate findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.
REQUIREMENTS
Analytical orientation and strong problem-solving skills, demonstrated by the ability to understand core business needs and get to the root of the inquiry.
Curious, internally-motivated self-starter with ability to plan, organize, and establish priorities to manage multiple projects and achieve results in a timely, scalable manner.
Have the ability to structure a concise, clear presentation of findings, based on large sets of complex data, and effectively present this to any level in the organization with appropriate visualizations.
Strong quantitative skills with a penchant for analytical query writing using SQL.
PLUSES
2+ years of work experience in Gaming, Data Analytics, Product Analytics, Data Science, Business Intelligence, or Product Management roles
BS degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Economics, or other quantitative field
Experience communicating and advocating with analytical insights to executive-level audiences to inform decision making
Demonstrated experience with some or all of the following: data modeling, data visualization, statistics
Highly proficient in SQL
Experience with cloud computing platforms and big data (such as Google Cloud Platform, BigQuery, Hadoop, Teradata, and/or Azure)
Adept in at least one visualization tool such as Tableau; R or Python knowledge is a plus
Familiar with agile project management tools such as Jira
APPLICATION MATERIALS
Resume
Cover Letter preferred

Parking and Transportation Junior Data Analyst
Dixon Resources Unlimited (DIXON) is a consulting firm that specializes in municipal parking, transportation, and mobility solutions. Our uniquely‐qualified team specializes in supporting municipal parking and mobility programs across the country, consistently proving our ability to identify and implement operations, management, and technology recommendations to transition municipal parking operations to long‐term, sustainable programs.
One of our key business objectives is to support our clients with the development of customized parking technology roadmaps that define current and future parking and transportation needs. We support cities with an array of services including parking studies, best practice comparisons, data analysis, incentive and pilot programs, TDM planning, financial modeling, stakeholder outreach, and developing technology, staffing, and wayfinding recommendations.
Job Summary
The Junior Data Analyst is an entry level position that will provide direct support to DIXON Data Analysts and Associates and is responsible for developing data collection plans, data collection, data entry, reviewing raw data outputs, processing data, producing reports, and extracting actionable intelligence. The ability to recognize and understand trends, collaborate with cross‐functional teams, and solve complex problems is key to success within this role.
Data primarily consist of parking occupancy, expressed as the number of vehicles per block face or off‐street location observed at a particular time, and parking turnover, expressed as the length of time that unique vehicles remain parked in certain on‐street or off‐street locations. The Junior Data Analyst will provide parking data assessments through a variety of methods such as utilizing GIS platforms, field collection, and license plate recognition technologies. The ideal candidate will have exceptional Excel skills, and maintain a high level of detail and accuracy.
While the role is data driven, the Junior Analyst will be required to articulate results both verbally and in written form to support a variety of project applications.
Responsibilities and Duties
The specific responsibilities of the Junior Data Analyst may change from time to time, requiring cooperation and adaptability as the needs of DIXON’s customers evolve. DIXON reserves the right to change, without prior notice, the assignments, duties, and reporting relationships for the Junior Data Analyst.
Key Responsibilities and Duties:
Assist in the creation of data collection strategies, coordinate the logistics of data collection, review the study area, and ensure appropriate collection practices;
Assist in field data collection and management (travel to job sites may be required);
Assist in project setup and data entry assignments;
Research, compile, and analyze data for trends and key takeaways;
Verify accuracy and completeness of raw data received;
Illustrate data with maps and graphically, and translate complex findings into written text;
Generate accurate reports that enable data driven decision‐making;
Ability to draft procedures and technical specifications;
Ability to write memoranda and reports using concise, and grammatically correct English;
Ensure that report deadlines are met and that information is accurate and complete;
Plan, initiate, and complete a variety of clerical duties for executive and professional staff;
Strong analytical, creative, and innovative approach to problem solving;
Ability to learn and use other software that DIXON may need; and,
Performs other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics, or related field
Entry level position but 1+ years relevant experience in applied business practices or analysis preferred
Experience in public policy, transportation planning, analytics, urban planning, or related field is preferred. Knowledge of parking and transportation demand management is recommended
Experience with GIS tools and map interfaces
Must have exceptional Excel skills with advanced knowledge of formulas
Strong analytical, creative, and innovative approach to problem solving
Detail‐oriented, self‐motivated, and able to work in a deadline‐driven environment
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Ability to translate business requirements into non‐technical, lay terms
Ability to prioritize workload, solve problems, stay organized, and interact with others to achieve an efficient workflow
Excellent interpersonal relationship skills, customer service experience, and the ability to work independently or as part of a team
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, Advanced Excel)
Possess a professional demeanor, with an ability to adapt to changing conditions
Must be willing to travel

This position supports the business needs of the Strategy department. The Data Analyst is responsible for data collection (uploading, compiling/formatting, cleaning, and vetting of data), analysis, interpretation and visualization; best practice research; maintenance and quality control of multiple large databases; and market/competitive intelligence for a wide range of business needs including strategic and service line planning, environmental assessments, regulatory submissions, and business development. Uploads, formats, cleans/vets, prepares, analyzes, interprets and summarizes data findings and generate analytical reports from multiple large databases with multiple variables, including visual representations in support of identified business needs.
Produces ACCURATE, valid and timely data analytics for business planning, contributes to the bench-marking of best practices and obtains other market/competitive intelligence and healthcare information (e.g., disease incidence, utilization rates, volume and rate forecasting, market share trending, vetting online information of healthcare providers, etc.). Proactively investigates data abnormalities and likely questions that will arise to reduce data iterations and increase productivity.

Proactively develops and maintains an accurate compendium of data and selected data sets in anticipation of the needs of the Department, Division and Organization.
Develops data collection instruments for planning and market assessment. Continually identifies opportunities for data analytics process improvement and automation. Implements those that are agreed upon with the Director of Strategy.
Assists in the development and evaluation of metrics (measures of success) and executive scorecards. Uses agreed-upon and innovative metrics for routine/quarterly progress monitoring.
Develop maps utilizing mapping software (e.g. Tableau) in support of specific business needs.

Come and join the Microsoft Browser Data Science team where we thrive on data to solve high impact business problems! We enable data driven decisions by converting data into insights that enhance customer experiences and improve business performance.

We partner closely with Engineering, Marketing, and Finance teams to answer key questions related to product adoption, engagement, satisfaction and monetization. Our work requires regular collaboration with our partner teams as well as technical expertise to mine big datasets and discover key insights.

To support this mission, we are looking for Data Analysts who have a passion for analyzing big data to uncover customer usage insights and driving those insights into actions with our partner teams.

The ideal candidate should be self-directed, passionate about data, and focused on delivering the right results. The candidate should be able to understand product strategy and business goals and apply programming acumen and a breadth of tools, data sources and analytical techniques to answer a wide range of high-impact business questions and present the insights in a concise and effective manner. Experience partnering with data scientists to develop business metrics and related insights is a big plus. Technical aptitude and programming skills are necessary in this role. The candidate should be an effective communicator capable of independently driving issues to resolution and communicating insights to different audiences ranging from executives to engineering feature teams.
Responsibilities

Build a holistic understanding of our product features, its customer, data infrastructure, product and business goals
Analyze complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources using a variety of tools and data analysis techniques
Develop analytical data sets in Azure or internal Big Data Environments which can be used to for analytics and data science
Understand business performance (trends, funnels) as well as answer product and business questions to drive product and marketing actions
Build and maintain learning plans for the product(s) with key analytical questions
Leverage industry best practices in establishing repeatable BI practices, principles & processes
Qualifications
Required Qualifications:
1+ years of professional experience in Data Analysis & Reporting
1+ years of experience working with SQL
Preferred Qualifications:
Unique mix of technical, development, project and program management skills
Ability to understand, translate and map business and product questions into analysis projects
Expertise in database technology with solid understanding and hands-on skills with SQL Server, SSIS, solid understanding of SSAS / n-dimensional cubes
Proficiency in advanced Excel functions (e.g., creating formulas, pivot tables) and PowerBI
Ability to influence diverse audiences and build strong partnerships with stakeholders
Self-motivated, agile and driven to think out-of-the-box
Experience building large scale data sets in Azure, AWS, Hadoop or similar big data environments
Strong ability to articulate vision, requirements & benefits, providing a solid rationale to business and technical partners
Experience using data from multiple sources to understand market trends & business impact
